infobox.Japanese title:: 呪いのミュージアム  (Noroi no Myūjiamu)
infobox.Cast:: Conan Edogawa  Ran Mouri  Sonoko Suzuki  Wataru Takagi  Kazunobu Chiba
infobox.Animation director:: Seiji Muta (supervisor)  Kaoru Nagakawa  tofu  Michitaka Yamamoto

infobox.Voice Cast::
Voice Cast:



Minami Takayama as Conan Edogawa  Wakana Yamazaki as Ran Mouri  Naoko Matsui as Sonoko Suzuki  Wataru Takagi as Wataru Takagi  Isshin Chiba as Kazunobu Chiba  Shin Mori as Ken Kowata  Masayo Kurata as Yuko Uchida  Ken Uo as Kiyoshi Yamada  Yohei Azakami as Takuto Ishikawa

sections.Situation:
Conan, Ran, and Sonoko are visiting Ancient Oriental Culture Museum to buy the famous Egyptian god keychain. When they are going to pay the keychain, the Anubis statue falls onto Hiroaki Uchida's body, and he is found dead.

The museum director, Ken Kowata, feared that it is Anubis' curse, but Conan notice that there is a wound on the victim's head. He also notice the broken platform where the statue was, which seems has been tampered with.
From the security camera, they found out that his wife, Yuko Uchida, also visited the museum that day, along with another visitor, Kiyoshi Yamada. Conan also suspects the museum director and his employee. All of the suspects have no solid alibi.
Takagi decides to check the victim's and the suspects' backgrounds. He finds out that Hiroaki was involved in many minor crimes, like cheating, brawling, and debt. Later, he receives a phone call from the museum director, who admits that he knows the culprit. However, the culprit is approaching Kowata, and he ends the call. The police rush to the museum, only to find Kowata is being cursed by Anubis. He drops the guest book before being taken to the police station.
Conan then finds out that Yuko has written some code that refers to the place where she will meet someone in the guest book.
